titles.ar: كتاب الزِّيِّ وَ التَّجَمُّلِ وَ الْمُرُوءَةِ
titles.en: The Book of Outfits and the Beautification and the Magnanimity

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ أَوْ غَيْرِهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَسْلَمَ الْجَبَلِيِّ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( صلوات الله عليه ) نِعْمَ الْبَيْتُ الْحَمَّامُ يُذَكِّرُ النَّارَ وَ يَذْهَبُ بِالدَّرَنِ وَ قَالَ عُمَرُ بِئْسَ الْبَيْتُ الْحَمَّامُ يُبْدِي الْعَوْرَةَ وَ يَهْتِكُ السِّتْرَ قَالَ وَ نَسَبَ النَّاسُ قَوْلَ أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) إِلَى عُمَرَ وَ قَوْلَ عُمَرَ إِلَى أَمِيرِ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from his father, or someone else from Muhammad Bin Aslam Al Jably, raising it, said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The best of the houses is the bathhouse. It reminds of the Fire and removes the filth’; and Umar said, ‘The worst of the houses is the bathhouse, it exposes the genitals and the tears down the veil’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘And the people ascribed the words of Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> to Umar and the words of Umar to Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup>’.

text: عَنْهُ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ وَ عَلِيِّ بْنِ حَسَّانَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الْحَمَّامُ يَوْمٌ وَ يَوْمٌ لَا يُكْثِرُ اللَّحْمَ وَ إِدْمَانُهُ فِي كُلِّ يَوْمٍ يُذِيبُ شَحْمَ الْكُلْيَتَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ali Bin Al Hakam and Ali Bin Hassan, from Suleyman Al Ja’fary,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Bathing a day, and not a day (alternatively) does not increase the flesh, and being habitual of it during every day removes the fat of the kidneys’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رِفَاعَةَ بْنِ مُوسَى عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ الْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلَا يَدْخُلِ الْحَمَّامَ إِلَّا بِمِئْزَرٍ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Rafa’at Bin Musa,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The one who was a believer in Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and the Last Day, so he should not enter the bathhouse except with a loincloth’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ الْحَجَّالِ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ قَالَ مَرِضْتُ حَتَّى ذَهَبَ لَحْمِي فَدَخَلْتُ عَلَى الرِّضَا ( صلوات الله عليه ) فَقَالَ أَ يَسُرُّكَ أَنْ يَعُودَ إِلَيْكَ لَحْمُكَ قُلْتُ بَلَى قَالَ الْزَمِ الْحَمَّامَ غِبّاً فَإِنَّهُ يَعُودُ إِلَيْكَ لَحْمُكَ وَ إِيَّاكَ أَنْ تُدْمِنَهُ فَإِنَّ إِدْمَانَهُ يُورِثُ السِّلَّ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Abdullah Bin Muhammad Al Hajjal, from Suleyman Al Ja’fary who said,

‘I was sick to the extent that my flesh went away. So I went over to Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Would you be joyful if I<sup>asws</sup> were to return your flesh to you?’ I said, ‘Yes’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Necessitate the bathing intermittently so it would return back to you your flesh, and beware of being habitual of it, for being habitual in it inherits the tuberculosis’.

text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنِ الْمُثَنَّى بْنِ الْوَلِيدِ الْحَنَّاطِ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا تَدْخُلِ الْحَمَّامَ إِلَّا وَ فِي جَوْفِكَ شَيْ‏ءٌ يُطْفَأُ بِهِ عَنْكَ وَهَجُ الْمَعِدَةِ وَ هُوَ أَقْوَى لِلْبَدَنِ وَ لَا تَدْخُلْهُ وَ أَنْتَ مُمْتَلِئٌ مِنَ الطَّعَامِ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Al Musna Bin Al Waleed Al Hannat, from Abu Baseer,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Do not enter the bathhouse except in your inside is something to cool down the heat of your stomach with, and it is more strengthening for your body, and do not enter it and you are filled up from the food’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ رِفَاعَةَ بْنِ مُوسَى عَمَّنْ أَخْبَرَهُ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَنَّهُ كَانَ إِذَا أَرَادَ دُخُولَ الْحَمَّامِ تَنَاوَلَ شَيْئاً فَأَكَلَهُ قَالَ قُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ النَّاسَ عِنْدَنَا يَقُولُونَ إِنَّهُ عَلَى الرِّيقِ أَجْوَدُ مَا يَكُونُ قَالَ لَا بَلْ يُؤْكَلُ شَيْ‏ءٌ قَبْلَهُ يُطْفِئُ الْمَرَارَةَ وَ يُسَكِّنُ حَرَارَةَ الْجَوْفِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Rafa’at Bin Musa, from the one who informed it,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> that whenever he<sup>asws</sup> wanted to enter the bathhouse, he<sup>asws</sup> took something, so he<sup>asws</sup> ate it. I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The people with us are saying that it is much better upon the empty stomach as can be’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No, but eating something before it cools the gallbladder and settles the heat of the interior’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ بَزِيعٍ جَمِيعاً عَنْ حَنَانِ بْنِ سَدِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِيهِ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ أَنَا وَ أَبِي وَ جَدِّي وَ عَمِّي حَمَّاماً بِالْمَدِينَةِ فَإِذَا رَجُلٌ فِي بَيْتِ الْمَسْلَخِ فَقَالَ لَنَا مِمَّنِ الْقَوْمُ فَقُلْنَا مِنْ أَهْلِ الْعِرَاقِ فَقَالَ وَ أَيُّ الْعِرَاقِ قُلْنَا كُوفِيُّونَ فَقَالَ مَرْحَباً بِكُمْ يَا أَهْلَ الْكُوفَةِ أَنْتُمُ الشِّعَارُ دُونَ الدِّثَارِ ثُمَّ قَالَ مَا يَمْنَعُكُمْ مِنَ الْأُزُرِ فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَالَ عَوْرَةُ الْمُؤْمِنِ عَلَى الْمُؤْمِنِ حَرَامٌ

قَالَ فَبَعَثَ إِلَى أَبِي كِرْبَاسَةً فَشَقَّهَا بِأَرْبَعَةٍ ثُمَّ أَخَذَ كُلُّ وَاحِدٍ مِنَّا وَاحِداً ثُمَّ دَخَلْنَا فِيهَا فَلَمَّا كُنَّا فِي الْبَيْتِ الْحَارِّ صَمَدَ لِجَدِّي فَقَالَ يَا كَهْلُ مَا يَمْنَعُكَ مِنَ الْخِضَابِ فَقَالَ لَهُ جَدِّي أَدْرَكْتُ مَنْ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنِّي وَ مِنْكَ لَا يَخْتَضِبُ قَالَ فَغَضِبَ لِذَلِكَ حَتَّى عَرَفْنَا غَضَبَهُ فِي الْحَمَّامِ قَالَ وَ مَنْ ذَلِكَ الَّذِي هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنِّي فَقَالَ أَدْرَكْتُ عَلِيَّ بْنَ أَبِي طَالِبٍ ( عليه السلام ) وَ هُوَ لَا يَخْتَضِبُ قَالَ فَنَكَسَ رَأْسَهُ وَ تَصَابَّ عَرَقاً فَقَالَ صَدَقْتَ وَ بَرِرْتَ

ثُمَّ قَالَ يَا كَهْلُ إِنْ تَخْتَضِبْ فَإِنَّ رَسُولَ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) قَدْ خَضَبَ وَ هُوَ خَيْرٌ مِنْ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) وَ إِنْ تَتْرُكْ فَلَكَ بِعَلِيٍّ سُنَّةٌ قَالَ فَلَمَّا خَرَجْنَا مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ سَأَلْنَا عَنِ الرَّجُلِ فَإِذَا هُوَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ الْحُسَيْنِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ مَعَهُ ابْنُهُ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Muhammad Bin Ismail Bin Bazie, altogether from Hanan Bin sadeyr, from his father who said,

‘I and my father, and my grandfather, and my uncle went over to a bathhouse at Al-Medina, so there was a man<sup>asws</sup> in the dressing room. So he said to us, ‘From whom are the people?’ So we said, ‘From the people of Al-Iraq’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘And from where in Al-Iraq?’ We said, ‘Kufians (from Kufa)’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘Welcome to you all, of people of Al-Kufa. You all are wearing clothes and are without a towel’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘What is preventing you from the loincloth, for Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The nakedness of the Believer upon the Believer is Prohibited’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘He<sup>asws</sup> sent a cloth to my father, so he tore it into four pieces, and each one of us took one from it. Then we entered into it. So when we were in the hot house, he<sup>asws</sup> turned towards my grandfather, so he<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘O elderly, what prevents you from the dyeing?’ So my grandfather said to him, ‘I was with someone who was better than me and you<sup>asws</sup>, who did not dye’. So he<sup>asws</sup> got so angered due to that to the extent that we recognised his<sup>asws</sup> anger in the bathhouse. He<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘And who is that who is better than me<sup>asws</sup>?’ So he said, ‘I was with Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Abu Talib<sup>asws</sup> and he<sup>asws</sup> did not dye’. He (the narrator) said, ‘So he<sup>asws</sup> bowed his head and perspired, so he<sup>asws</sup> said, ‘You speak the truth, and are justified’.

Then he said, ‘O elderly, you should dye, for Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> had dyed, and he<sup>saww</sup> was better than Ali<sup>asws</sup>, and if you leave it, so for you is a Sunnah with Ali<sup>asws</sup>’. So when we went out from the bathhouse, we asked about the man, so it was Ali<sup>asws</sup> Bin Al-Husayn<sup>asws</sup> and with him<sup>asws</sup> was his<sup>asws</sup> son<sup>asws</sup> Muhammad<sup>asws</sup> Bin Ali<sup>asws</sup>’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ مَعَ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ الْحَمَّامَ فَنَظَرْتُ إِلَى أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَدِ اطَّلَى وَ اطَّلَى إِبْطَيْهِ بِالنُّورَةِ قَالَ فَخَبَّرْتُ أَبَا بَصِيرٍ فَقَالَ أَرْشِدْنِي إِلَيْهِ لِأَسْأَلَهُ عَنْهُ فَقُلْتُ قَدْ رَأَيْتُهُ أَنَا فَقَالَ أَنْتَ قَدْ رَأَيْتَهُ وَ أَنَا لَمْ أَرَهُ أَرْشِدْنِي إِلَيْهِ قَالَ فَأَرْشَدْتُهُ إِلَيْهِ فَقَالَ لَهُ جُعِلْتُ فِدَاكَ أَخْبَرَنِي قَائِدِي أَنَّكَ قَدِ اطَّلَيْتَ وَ طَلَيْتَ إِبْطَيْكَ بِالنُّورَةِ قَالَ نَعَمْ يَا أَبَا مُحَمَّدٍ إِنَّ نَتْفَ الْإِبْطَيْنِ يُضْعِفُ الْبَصَرَ اطَّلِ يَا أَبَا مُحَمَّدٍ قَالَ فَقَالَ اطَّلَيْتُ مُنْذُ أَيَّامٍ فَقَالَ اطَّلِ فَإِنَّهُ طَهُورٌ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza who said,

‘I entered the bathhouse along with Abu Baseer, so we looked at Abu Abdullahasws had waxed, and heasws had waxed hisasws underarms with Al-Noura. So I informed Abu Baseer, so he said, ‘Guide me to himasws to ask himasws about it’. So I said, ‘I have seen himasws’. So he said, ‘You have seen himasws, and I cannot see himasws’, (as he was blind). Guide me to himasws’. So I guided him to himasws, so he said to himasws, ‘May I be sacrificed for youasws! My guide informed me that youasws have waxed, and waxed yourasws underarms with Al-Noura’. Heasws said: ‘Yes, O Abu Muhammad! Plucking the underarms weakens the vision. Wax, O Abu Muhammad’. So he said, ‘I have waxed a few days beforehand’. So heasws said: ‘Wax, for it is cleaner’.

text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ رَجُلٍ مِنْ بَنِي هَاشِمٍ قَالَ دَخَلْتُ عَلَى جَمَاعَةٍ مِنْ بَنِي هَاشِمٍ فَسَلَّمْتُ عَلَيْهِمْ فِي بَيْتٍ مُظْلِمٍ فَقَالَ بَعْضُهُمْ سَلِّمْ عَلَى أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) فَإِنَّهُ فِي الصَّدْرِ قَالَ فَسَلَّمْتُ عَلَيْهِ وَ جَلَسْتُ بَيْنَ يَدَيْهِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ قَدْ أَحْبَبْتُ أَنْ أَلْقَاكَ مُنْذُ حِينٍ لِأَسْأَلَكَ عَنْ أَشْيَاءَ فَقَالَ سَلْ مَا بَدَا لَكَ قُلْتُ مَا تَقُولُ فِي الْحَمَّامِ قَالَ لَا تَدْخُلِ الْحَمَّامَ إِلَّا بِمِئْزَرٍ وَ غُضَّ بَصَرَكَ وَ لَا تَغْتَسِلْ مِنْ غُسَالَةِ مَاءِ الْحَمَّامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُغْتَسَلُ فِيهِ مِنَ الزِّنَا وَ يَغْتَسِلُ فِيهِ وَلَدُ الزِّنَا وَ النَّاصِبُ لَنَا أَهْلَ الْبَيْتِ وَ هُوَ شَرُّهُمْ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam,

(It has been narrated) from a man from the Clan of Hashimas who said, ‘I went over to a group from the Clan of Hashimas, so I greeted them in a dark room. So one of them said, ‘Greet Abu Al Hassanasws, for heasws is in the centre’. So I greeted himasws and sat in front of himasws, and I said to himasws, ‘I desired to meet youasws for a while to ask youasws about certain things’. So heasws said: ‘Ask, whatever comes to you’. I said, ‘What are youasws saying regarding the bathhouse’. Heasws said: ‘Do not enter the bathhouse except with a loincloth, and lowering your eyes, and do not wash from the used water of the bathhouse for there has washed in it the adulterer, and the son of the adulterer, and the Hostile one (Nasibi) towards usasws, the Peopleasws of the Household, and he is the most evil of them’.

text: أَحْمَدُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ أَشْيَمَ عَنْ سُلَيْمَانَ الْجَعْفَرِيِّ قَالَ مَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَحْمِلَ لَحْماً فَلْيَدْخُلِ الْحَمَّامَ يَوْماً وَ يَغِبُّ يَوْماً وَ مَنْ أَرَادَ أَنْ يَضْمُرَ وَ كَانَ كَثِيرَ اللَّحْمِ فَلْيَدْخُلِ الْحَمَّامَ كُلَّ يَوْمٍ .

en.hubeali: Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Ahmad Bin Asheym, from Suleyman Al Ja’fary,

(He<sup>asws</sup>) having said: ‘The one who wants to carry flesh (to gain weight) so let him enter the bathhouse one day, and be absent from it one day, and the one who intends slimming and he was of a lot of flesh, so let him enter the bathhouse every day’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ الْحَجَّاجِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَطَّلِي بِالنُّورَةِ فَيَجْعَلُ لَهُ الدَّقِيقَ بِالزَّيْتِ يَلُتُّ بِهِ فَيَمْسَحُ بِهِ بَعْدَ النُّورَةِ لِيَقْطَعَ رِيحَهَا عَنْهُ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Abdul Rahman Bin Al Hajjaj who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullahasws about the man who waxes with Al-Noura, so he makes a container for himself of the flour with the oil to paste with it, so he touches with it upon himself after Al-Noura in order to cut-off its smell from himself’. Heasws said: ‘There is no problem’.

text: وَ فِي حَدِيثٍ آخَرَ لِعَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ قَالَ رَأَيْتُ أَبَا الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) وَ قَدْ تَدَلَّكَ بِدَقِيقٍ مَلْتُوتٍ بِالزَّيْتِ فَقُلْتُ لَهُ إِنَّ النَّاسَ يَكْرَهُونَ ذَلِكَ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: And in another Hadeeth of Abdul Rahman, he said,

‘I saw Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup> and he had massaged with flour mixed with oil. So I said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘The people are disliking that’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ إِسْحَاقَ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْعَزِيزِ قَالَ سُئِلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ التَّدَلُّكِ بِالدَّقِيقِ بَعْدَ النُّورَةِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ قُلْتُ يَزْعُمُونَ أَنَّهُ إِسْرَافٌ فَقَالَ لَيْسَ فِيمَا أَصْلَحَ الْبَدَنَ إِسْرَافٌ إِنِّي رُبَّمَا أَمَرْتُ بِالنَّقِيِّ فَيُلَتُّ لِي بِالزَّيْتِ فَأَتَدَلَّكُ بِهِ إِنَّمَا الْإِسْرَافُ فِيمَا أَتْلَفَ الْمَالَ وَ أَضَرَّ بِالْبَدَنِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Usman Bin Isa, from Is’haq Bin Abdul Aziz who said,

‘Abu Abdullahasws was asked about the massaging with the flour (mixed with oil) after Al-Noura, so heasws said: ‘There is no problem’. I said, ‘They (people) are alleging that it is an extravagance’. So heasws said: ‘There is no extravagance in the correction (well-being) of the body. Sometimes I order with the pure (flour), so it is mixed for measws with the oil, so I massage with it. But rather, the extravagance is in what is destruction of the wealth and harmful for the body’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنِ الْفَضْلِ بْنِ شَاذَانَ جَمِيعاً عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ هِشَامِ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( صلوات الله عليه ) فِي الرَّجُلِ يَطَّلِي وَ يَتَدَلَّكُ بِالزَّيْتِ وَ الدَّقِيقِ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, and Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Al fazl Bin Shazaan, altogether from Abu Abu Umeyr, from Hisham Bin Al Hakam,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Al Hassan<sup>asws</sup> regarding the man who waxes and massages with the oil and the flour. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it’.

text: عَلِيٌّ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَسْلَمَ الْجَبَلِيِّ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ تَغْلِبَ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّا لَنُسَافِرُ وَ لَا يَكُونُ مَعَنَا نُخَالَةٌ فَنَتَدَلَّكُ بِالدَّقِيقِ فَقَالَ لَا بَأْسَ إِنَّمَا الْفَسَادُ فِيمَا أَضَرَّ بِالْبَدَنِ وَ أَتْلَفَ الْمَالَ فَأَمَّا مَا أَصْلَحَ الْبَدَنَ فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ بِفَسَادٍ إِنِّي رُبَّمَا أَمَرْتُ غُلَامِي فَلَتَّ لِيَ النَّقِيَّ بِالزَّيْتِ فَأَتَدَلَّكُ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ahmad, from Muhammad Bin Aslam Al Jabaly, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza, from Aban Bin Taglub who said,

‘I said to Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘We tend to travel and there does not happen to be any bran with us, so we massage with the flour’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem. But rather, the spoiling is in what is harmful for the body, and the destruction of the wealth. So as for what is corrective for the body, so it is no with spoiling. Sometimes I<sup>asws</sup> order my<sup>asws</sup> slave, ‘Prepare for me<sup>asws</sup> the pure flour with the oil, so I<sup>asws</sup> massage with it’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ سَيْفِ بْنِ عَمِيرَةَ قَالَ خَرَجَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ فَتَلَبَّسَ وَ تَعَمَّمَ فَقَالَ لِي إِذَا خَرَجْتَ مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ فَتَعَمَّمْ قَالَ فَمَا تَرَكْتُ الْعِمَامَةَ عِنْدَ خُرُوجِي مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ فِي شِتَاءٍ وَ لَا صَيْفٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Sayf Bin Ameyra who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> went out from the bathhouse, so he<sup>asws</sup> had worn clothes and a turban. He<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘Whenever you come out from the bathhouse, so wear a turban’. He (the narrator) said, ‘So I did not neglect the turban during my coming out from the bathhouse, during the winter and the summer’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رَجُلٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ سَأَلْتُهُ عَنِ الرَّجُلِ يَطَّلِي فَيَبُولُ وَ هُوَ قَائِمٌ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ بِهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from a man,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, said, ‘I asked him<sup>asws</sup> about the man who waxes, and he urinates while he is standing’. He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem with it’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ التَّيْمِيِّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( صلوات الله عليه ) يَقُولُ أَلَا لَا يَسْتَلْقِيَنَّ أَحَدُكُمْ فِي الْحَمَّامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُذِيبُ شَحْمَ الْكُلْيَتَيْنِ وَ لَا يَدْلُكَنَّ رِجْلَيْهِ بِالْخَزَفِ فَإِنَّهُ يُورِثُ الْجُذَامَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ali Bin Al Hassan Al Taymi, from Muhammad Bin Abu Hamza, from Umar Bin Yazeed,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘Indeed! Not one of you should lie down in the bathhouse, for it melts the fat of the kidneys, and he should not massage his leg with the clay for it inherits the leprosy’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى رَفَعَهُ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُسْكَانَ قَالَ كُنَّا جَمَاعَةً مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا دَخَلْنَا الْحَمَّامَ فَلَمَّا خَرَجْنَا لَقِيَنَا أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) فَقَالَ لَنَا مِنْ أَيْنَ أَقْبَلْتُمْ فَقُلْنَا لَهُ مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ فَقَالَ أَنْقَى اللَّهُ غَسْلَكُمْ فَقُلْنَا لَهُ جُعِلْنَا فِدَاكَ وَ إِنَّا جِئْنَا مَعَهُ حَتَّى دَخَلَ الْحَمَّامَ فَجَلَسْنَا لَهُ حَتَّى خَرَجَ فَقُلْنَا لَهُ أَنْقَى اللَّهُ غَسْلَكَ فَقَالَ طَهَّرَكُمُ اللَّهُ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, raising it, from Abdullah Bin Muskan who said,

‘We were a group of our companions, and we entered the bathhouse. So when we went out, we met Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, so he<sup>asws</sup> said to us: ‘Where are you coming back from?’ So we said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘From the bathhouse’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Purify your bathing’. So we said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May we be sacrificed for you<sup>asws</sup>’. And we went with him<sup>asws</sup> until he<sup>asws</sup> entered the bathhouse. So we sat around (waiting) for him<sup>asws</sup> until he<sup>asws</sup> came out. So we said to him<sup>asws</sup>, ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Purify your<sup>asws</sup> bathing’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘May Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Clean you all’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ وَ عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ بُنْدَارَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ النَّهَاوَنْدِيِّ عَنْ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ بْنِ حَمَّادٍ عَنْ أَبِي مَرْيَمَ الْأَنْصَارِيِّ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ إِنَّ الْحَسَنَ بْنَ عَلِيٍّ ( عليه السلام ) خَرَجَ مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ فَلَقِيَهُ إِنْسَانٌ فَقَالَ طَابَ اسْتِحْمَامُكَ فَقَالَ يَا لُكَعُ وَ مَا تَصْنَعُ بِالِاسْتِ هَاهُنَا فَقَالَ طَابَ حَمِيمُكَ فَقَالَ أَ مَا تَعْلَمُ أَنَّ الْحَمِيمَ الْعَرَقُ قَالَ فَطَابَ حَمَّامُكَ قَالَ وَ إِذَا طَابَ حَمَّامِي فَأَيُّ شَيْ‏ءٍ لِي وَ لَكِنْ قُلْ طَهُرَ مَا طَابَ مِنْكَ وَ طَابَ مَا طَهُرَ مِنْكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, and Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Bundar, from Ibrahim Bin Is’haq Al Nahawandy, from Abdul Rahman Bin Hammad, from Abu Maryam Al Ansary, raising it, said,

‘Al-Hassanasws Bin Aliasws went out from the bathhouse, a person came across himasws, so he said, ‘May yourasws Istihmamuk be good’. So heasws said: ‘O dimwit, and are you doing with utilising the ‘ist’ over here (in the word)?’ So he said, ‘May your Hameemuk be good’. So heasws said: ‘But do you not know that Al-Hameem is the perspiration?’ He said, ‘May your Hamaamuk be good’. Heasws said: ‘And when myasws bathing is good, so which thing is for measws, but say, ‘May it be purified what is good from youasws, and may it be good what is purified from youasws’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ يَسَارٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عَفَّانَ السَّدُوسِيِّ عَنْ بَشِيرٍ النَّبَّالِ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) عَنِ الْحَمَّامِ فَقَالَ تُرِيدُ الْحَمَّامَ فَقُلْتُ نَعَمْ

قَالَ فَأَمَرَ بِإِسْخَانِ الْحَمَّامِ ثُمَّ دَخَلَ فَاتَّزَرَ بِإِزَارٍ وَ غَطَّى رُكْبَتَيْهِ وَ سُرَّتَهُ ثُمَّ أَمَرَ صَاحِبَ الْحَمَّامِ فَطَلَى مَا كَانَ خَارِجاً مِنَ الْإِزَارِ ثُمَّ قَالَ اخْرُجْ عَنِّي ثُمَّ طَلَى هُوَ مَا تَحْتَهُ بِيَدِهِ ثُمَّ قَالَ هَكَذَا فَافْعَلْ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companons, from sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Isa, from Ismail Bin Yasaar, from Usman Bin Affan Al Sadousy, from Basheer Al Nabaal who said,
‘I asked Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> the bathhouse, so he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Do you want to bathing?’ So I said, ‘Yes’.

He (the narrator) said, ‘So he<sup>asws</sup> ordered with the warming of the bath, then he<sup>asws</sup> entered it, and he<sup>asws</sup> was wearing a trouser, and his<sup>asws</sup> knees were covered, as well as his<sup>asws</sup> navel. Then he<sup>asws</sup> ordered the one in charge of the bathhouse, so he<sup>asws</sup> anointed what was outside from the trouser. Then he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘go away from me<sup>asws</sup>’. Then he<sup>asws</sup> anointed what was underneath it by his<sup>asws</sup> own hands, then said: ‘This is how, so do it’.

text: سَهْلٌ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَا يَدْخُلِ الرَّجُلُ مَعَ ابْنِهِ الْحَمَّامَ فَيَنْظُرَ إِلَى عَوْرَتِهِ .

en.hubeali: Sahl, raising it, said,
‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘The man should not enter the bathhouse along with his son, so that he would look at his nakedness’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ بُنْدَارَ عَنْ إِبْرَاهِيمَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ يُوسُفَ بْنِ السُّخْتِ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ قَالَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) لَا تَتَّكِ فِي الْحَمَّامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُذِيبُ شَحْمَ الْكُلْيَتَيْنِ وَ لَا تُسَرِّحْ فِي الْحَمَّامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُرَقِّقُ الشَّعْرَ وَ لَا تَغْسِلْ رَأْسَكَ بِالطِّينِ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْغَيْرَةِ وَ لَا تَتَدَلَّكْ بِالْخَزَفِ فَإِنَّهُ يُورِثُ الْبَرَصَ وَ لَا تَمْسَحْ وَجْهَكَ بِالْإِزَارِ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْهَبُ بِمَاءِ الْوَجْهِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Bundar, from Ibrahim Bin Is’haq, from Yusuf Bin Al Sukht, raising it, said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Do not lean (reclining posture) in the bathhouse, for it melts the fat of the kidneys; and do not comb in the bathhouse, for it thins the hair; and do not wash your head with the clay, for it removed the self-esteem; and do not massage with the clay for it inherits the vitiligo; and do not wipe your face with the trouser for it removes the water of the face’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَسْبَاطٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا تَغْسِلُوا رُءُوسَكُمْ بِطِينِ مِصْرَ فَإِنَّهُ يَذْهَبُ بِالْغَيْرَةِ وَ يُورِثُ الدِّيَاثَةَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ali Bin Asbaat,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘Do not wash your heads with Egyptian clay, for it removes the self-esteem and in inherits the despicability’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ أَبِي يَحْيَى الْوَاسِطِيِّ عَنْ بَعْضِ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الْمَاضِي ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ الْعَوْرَةُ عَوْرَتَانِ الْقُبُلُ وَ الدُّبُرُ فَأَمَّا الدُّبُرُ مَسْتُورٌ بِالْأَلْيَتَيْنِ فَإِذَا سَتَرْتَ الْقَضِيبَ وَ الْبَيْضَتَيْنِ فَقَدْ سَتَرْتَ الْعَوْرَةَ
وَ قَالَ فِي رِوَايَةٍ أُخْرَى وَ أَمَّا الدُّبُرُ فَقَدْ سَتَرَتْهُ الْأَلْيَتَانِ وَ أَمَّا الْقُبُلُ فَاسْتُرْهُ بِيَدِكَ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Isa, from Abu Yahya Al Wasity, from one of our companions,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Al-Hassan Al-Maazy<sup>asws</sup> (7<sup>th</sup> Imam<sup>asws</sup>) having said: ‘The private parts are of two types, the front and the back. So as for the back, it is veiled by the two buttocks. So when the manhood and the two organs (under it) are veiled, so the private parts have been veiled’.
And he<sup>asws</sup> said in another report: ‘And as for the back, so the two buttocks have veiled it, and as for the front, so veil it with your hands’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ غَيْرِ وَاحِدٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ النَّظَرُ إِلَى عَوْرَةِ مَنْ لَيْسَ بِمُسْلِمٍ مِثْلُ نَظَرِكَ إِلَى عَوْرَةِ الْحِمَارِ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from someone else,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The looking at a private part of the one who is not a Muslim is like looking at the private parts of the donkey’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ الْحَكَمِ عَنْ أَبَانِ بْنِ عُثْمَانَ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) أَ يَتَجَرَّدُ الرَّجُلُ عِنْدَ صَبِّ الْمَاءِ تُرَى عَوْرَتُهُ أَوْ يُصَبُّ عَلَيْهِ الْمَاءُ أَوْ يَرَى هُوَ عَوْرَةَ النَّاسِ فَقَالَ كَانَ أَبِي يَكْرَهُ ذَلِكَ مِنْ كُلِّ أَحَدٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Al Hakam, from Aban Bin Usman, from Ibn Abu Yafour who said,

‘I asked Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Can the man be bare during the pouring of the water to see his own private parts, or the water is poured over him, or he see the private parts of the people?’ So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘My<sup>asws</sup> father<sup>asws</sup> disliked that from every one’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ رِفَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ الْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلَا يُدْخِلْ حَلِيلَتَهُ الْحَمَّامَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Rafa’at,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who was a believer in Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and the Last Day, so he should not let his wife go to the bathhouse’.

text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ خَالِدٍ عَنْ عُثْمَانَ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ الْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلَا يُرْسِلْ حَلِيلَتَهُ إِلَى الْحَمَّامِ .

en.hubeali: A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Khalid, from Usman Bin Isa, from Sama’at,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who was a believer in Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and the Last Day, so he should not send his wife to the bathhouse’.

text: عَنْهُ عَنْ إِسْمَاعِيلَ بْنِ مِهْرَانَ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ يَقْطِينٍ قَالَ قُلْتُ لِأَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) أَقْرَأُ الْقُرْآنَ فِي الْحَمَّامِ وَ أَنْكِحُ قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: From him, from Ismail Bin Mihran, from Muhammad Bin Abu Hamza, from Ali Bin Yaqteen who said,
‘I said to Abu Al-Hassan<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Reciting the Quran in the bathhouse and the copulation?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no problem’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنْ حَمَّادِ بْنِ عِيسَى عَنْ رِبْعِيِّ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ مُسْلِمٍ قَالَ سَأَلْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) أَ كَانَ أَمِيرُ الْمُؤْمِنِينَ ( عليه السلام ) يَنْهَى عَنْ قِرَاءَةِ الْقُرْآنِ فِي الْحَمَّامِ قَالَ لَا إِنَّمَا نَهَى أَنْ يَقْرَأَ الرَّجُلُ وَ هُوَ عُرْيَانٌ فَأَمَّا إِذَا كَانَ عَلَيْهِ إِزَارٌ فَلَا بَأْسَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, form his father, from Hammad Bin Isa, from Rabi’e Bin Abdullah, from Muhammad Bin Muslim who said,

‘I asked Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, ‘Was Amir Al-Momineen<sup>asws</sup> forbidding from reciting the Quran in the bathhouse?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘No, but rather he<sup>asws</sup> had forbidden that the man should be reciting whilst he is naked. So when there was a trouser upon him, so there is no problem’.

text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ عَنْ حَمَّادٍ عَنِ الْحَلَبِيِّ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ لَا بَأْسَ لِلرَّجُلِ أَنْ يَقْرَأَ الْقُرْآنَ فِي الْحَمَّامِ إِذَا كَانَ يُرِيدُ بِهِ وَجْهَ اللَّهِ وَ لَا يُرِيدُ يَنْظُرُ كَيْفَ صَوْتُهُ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahimm, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, from Hammad, from Al Halby,

(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘There is no problem for the man that he should recite the Quran in the bathhouse, when he intends the Face of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> by it, and he does not want to look at how (good) his voice was’.

text: بَعْضُ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنِ ابْنِ جُمْهُورٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي يَعْفُورٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ لَا تَضْطَجِعْ فِي الْحَمَّامِ فَإِنَّهُ يُذِيبُ شَحْمَ الْكُلْيَتَيْنِ .

en.hubeali: One of our companions, from Ibn Jamhour, from Muhammad Bin Al Qasim, from Ibn Abu Yafour,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Do not lie down in the bathhouse, for it melts the fat of the kidneys’.

text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ أَحْمَدَ عَنْ عُمَرَ بْنِ عَلِيِّ بْنِ عُمَرَ بْنِ يَزِيدَ عَنْ عَمِّهِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عُمَرَ عَنْ بَعْضِ مَنْ حَدَّثَهُ أَنَّ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) كَانَ يَقُولُ مَنْ كَانَ يُؤْمِنُ بِاللَّهِ وَ الْيَوْمِ الْآخِرِ فَلَا يَدْخُلِ الْحَمَّامَ إِلَّا بِمِئْزَرٍ

الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ مُعَلَّى بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ بَعْضِ رِجَالِهِ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ قَالَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) لَا يَدْخُلِ الرَّجُلُ مَعَ ابْنِهِ الْحَمَّامَ فَيَنْظُرَ إِلَى عَوْرَتِهِ

وَ قَالَ لَيْسَ لِلْوَالِدَيْنِ أَنْ يَنْظُرَا إِلَى عَوْرَةِ الْوَلَدِ وَ لَيْسَ لِلْوَلَدِ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ إِلَى عَوْرَةِ الْوَالِدِ وَ قَالَ لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) النَّاظِرَ وَ الْمَنْظُورَ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْحَمَّامِ بِلَا مِئْزَرٍ .

وَ قَالَ لَيْسَ لِلْوَالِدَيْنِ أَنْ يَنْظُرَا إِلَى عَوْرَةِ الْوَلَدِ وَ لَيْسَ لِلْوَلَدِ أَنْ يَنْظُرَ إِلَى عَوْرَةِ الْوَالِدِ وَ قَالَ لَعَنَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) النَّاظِرَ وَ الْمَنْظُورَ إِلَيْهِ فِي الْحَمَّامِ بِلَا مِئْزَرٍ .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Ahmad, from Umar Bin Ali Bin Umar Bin Yazeed, from his uncle Muhammad Bin Umar, from one who narrated it that,
‘Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> was saying: ‘The one who was a believer in Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and the Last Day, so he should not enter the bathhouse except with a loin cloth’.
Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Moala Bin Muhammad, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad Bin Abdullah, from Muhammad Bin Ja’far, from one of his men,
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said: ‘The man should not enter the bathhouse along with his son, so he would look at his nakedness’.
And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘It is not for the parent that they should look at the private part of the children, and it is not the children that they should look at the nakedness of the parents’.
And he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> cursed the onlooker and the one looked at in the bathhouse, without a trouser’.

text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ إِسْحَاقَ عَنْ سَعْدَانَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ قَالَ دَخَلَ أَبُو عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) الْحَمَّامَ فَقَالَ لَهُ صَاحِبُ الْحَمَّامِ أُخْلِيهِ لَكَ فَقَالَ لَا حَاجَةَ لِي فِي ذَلِكَ الْمُؤْمِنُ أَخَفُّ مِنْ ذَلِكَ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, from Ahmad Bin Is’haq, form sa’adan, from Abu Baseer who said,

‘Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> entered the bathhouse, so the one in charge of the bathhouse said to him, ‘I shall empty it for you<sup>asws</sup>’. So he<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘There is no need for me<sup>asws</sup> with regards to that is hidden from that’.

text: الْحُسَيْنُ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَعْدٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ سَالِمٍ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ مُوسَى قَالَ حَدَّثَنَا مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَبِي الْحَسَنِ الرِّضَا ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ مَنْ أَخَذَ مِنَ الْحَمَّامِ خَزَفَةً فَحَكَّ بِهَا جَسَدَهُ فَأَصَابَهُ الْبَرَصُ فَلَا يَلُومَنَّ إِلَّا نَفْسَهُ وَ مَنِ اغْتَسَلَ مِنَ الْمَاءِ الَّذِي قَدِ اغْتُسِلَ فِيهِ فَأَصَابَهُ الْجُذَامُ فَلَا يَلُومَنَّ إِلَّا نَفْسَهُ

قَالَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ عَلِيٍّ فَقُلْتُ لِأَبِي الْحَسَنِ ( عليه السلام ) إِنَّ أَهْلَ الْمَدِينَةِ يَقُولُونَ إِنَّ فِيهِ شِفَاءً مِنَ الْعَيْنِ فَقَالَ كَذَبُوا يَغْتَسِلُ فِيهِ الْجُنُبُ مِنَ الْحَرَامِ وَ الزَّانِي وَ النَّاصِبُ الَّذِي هُوَ شَرُّهُمَا وَ كُلُّ خَلْقٍ مِنْ خَلْقِ اللَّهِ ثُمَّ يَكُونُ فِيهِ شِفَاءٌ مِنَ الْعَيْنِ إِنَّمَا شِفَاءُ الْعَيْنِ قِرَاءَةُ الْحَمْدِ وَ الْمُعَوِّذَتَيْنِ وَ آيَةِ الْكُرْسِيِّ وَ الْبَخُورُ بِالْقُسْطِ وَ الْمُرِّ وَ اللُّبَانِ .

en.hubeali: Al Husayn Bin Muhammad, and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Ali Bin Muhammad Bin Sa’ad, from Muhammad Bin salim, from Musa Bin Abdullah Bin Musa,

‘Muhammad Bin Ali, son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> narrated to us from Abu Al-Hassan Al-Reza<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘The one who takes clay from the bathhouse and he rubs his body with it, so the vitiligo hits him, so he should not blame anyone except for himself; and the one who washed from the water which had been bathed in, and the leprosy hits him, so he should not blame anyone except for himself’.

Muhammad Bin Ali (the narrator) said, ‘So I said to Abu Al-Hassanasws that the people of Al-Medina are saying that there is a healing in it from the (evil) eyes’. So heasws said: ‘They are lying! There bathe in it the ones who have sexual impurities from the Prohibition (adultery), and the adulterer, and the Hostile one (Nasibi) who is the most evil of them, and every creature from the creatures of Allahazwj, then there would be a healing in it? But rather, a healing from the (evil) eye is recitation of Al-Hamd (Chapter 1), and Al-Mawazatayn (Chapter 113 & 114), and the Verse of the Chair (2:255), and the vapour of the incense with Al-Qust (saussurea), and Al-Murr (myrhh), and Al-Loban (frankincense)’.
